title: How to Eat Kefir

steps.headline: Drink plain kefir by itself.
steps.description: Many people drink kefir straight without mixing it with anything else. Whether you’re using homemade kefir or kefir you bought at the store, you can just pour yourself a glass and drink it plain. Having a glass of plain kefir every morning can help aid digestion and protect your stomach lining.

steps.headline: Drink flavored kefir.
steps.description: Find premade flavored kefir at your local grocery store, or you can make your own at home. To flavor your own, pour some kefir in a glass and sprinkle spices in it, like cinnamon, cocoa powder, and pumpkin spice. Stir the spices into your kefir with a spoon.

steps.headline: Buy or make water kefir if you’re sensitive to dairy.
steps.description: Similarly to milk kefir, water kefir is full of healthy probiotics, so you can still get the nutritional benefit of kefir by drinking it. Drink water kefir plain or steep tea bags in it to make kefir tea.

steps.headline: Make salad dressings with kefir.
steps.description: Kefir can be used in place of yogurt and cream in salad dressing recipes. To make a kefir ranch dressing, combine .6 cups (140 mL) of kefir, .3 cups (71 mL) of mayonnaise, 2 tablespoons (30 mL) of lemon juice, 1.5 teaspoons (7.4 mL) of dijon mustard, and .5 teaspoons (2.5 mL) of anchovy paste in a bowl. Season with .5 teaspoons (2.5 mL) of both salt and pepper. Then, stir in .5 cups (120 mL) of grated parmesan cheese.

steps.headline: Bake kefir quick breads and muffins.
steps.description: Kefir works great in recipes like banana bread or banana nut muffins. If a recipe calls for milk, use the same amount of kefir instead. It's an easy substitution, and it will make your quick breads and muffins healthier.

steps.headline: Make kefir ice cream.
steps.description: To make a vanilla kefir ice cream, just combine 2 cups (470 mL) of kefir, .6 cups (140 mL) of sugar, 1 cup (240 mL) of heavy whipping cream, and 2 tablespoons (30 mL) of vanilla extract in a large bowl. Churn the ingredients together until the mixture is creamy. Eat the ice cream as is, or freeze it in an ice cream box so the consistency is harder.

steps.headline: Add kefir to your smoothies instead of milk or cream.
steps.description: Blend .5 cups (120 mL) of kefir, .5 cups (120 mL) of frozen strawberries, 1 tablespoon (15 mL) of lemon juice, and 1 tablespoon (15 mL) of honey in a blender. Once the smoothie is blended, pour it into a glass and serve!

steps.headline: Preheat your oven to 350 °F (177 °C) and prepare a loaf pan.
steps.description: Line the loaf pan with parchment paper so that the bottom and sides of the pan are covered. Then, grease the parchment paper by spraying it with a non-stick cooking spray. Set the loaf pan aside.

steps.headline: Mix 1 stick of melted butter and 1 cup (240 mL) of sugar in a bowl.
steps.description: Melt the butter in the microwave using a microwave-safe bowl, or melt it in a pot over the stovetop. Stir the melted butter and sugar until they’re thoroughly combined.

steps.headline: Add your liquid ingredients to the butter and sugar.
steps.description: Add .25 cups (59 mL) of kefir, 1 teaspoon (4.9 mL) of vanilla, and 2 eggs to the butter and sugar and use a whisk to mix all the ingredients together. Continue whisking until the batter is smooth. For an even tastier kefir banana bread, sprinkle some chocolate chips or nuts into the batter.

steps.headline: Peel 3 ripe bananas and mash them into the batter.
steps.description: Use the whisk or a fork to mash the bananas. If you want a chunky kefir banana bread, leave some banana chunks in the batter. If you want a smooth kefir banana bread, mash the bananas completely and whisk the batter until it’s smooth.

steps.headline: Add your dry ingredients to the batter.
steps.description: Pour 2 cups (470 mL) of flour, 1 teaspoon (4.9 mL) of baking soda, and .5 teaspoons (2.5 mL) of salt into the bowl with the batter. Then, use a spatula to stir the ingredients together until you can’t see anymore of the dry flour.

steps.headline: Transfer the batter into the loaf pan.
steps.description: After you pour the batter into the pan, use the spatula to scoop out any remaining batter in the bowl. Even out the top of the batter in the pan using the spatula.

steps.headline: Bake the kefir banana bread for 1 hour.
steps.description: Check on the bread after 50 minutes to make sure it’s not burning. When the top of the kefir banana bread is dark brown and hardened, it’s finished baking.

steps.headline: Remove the bread from the oven and let it cool for 20 minutes before serving.
steps.description: After 20 minutes, remove the the loaf of bread from the pan and cut it into slices. You can store your leftover bread at room temperature for up to 3 days, or in the freezer for 3 months.

It's an easy substitution, and it will make your quick breads and muffins healthier. Make kefir ice cream. To make a vanilla kefir ice cream, just combine 2 cups (470 mL) of kefir, .6 cups (140 mL) of sugar, 1 cup (240 mL) of heavy whipping cream, and 2 tablespoons (30 mL) of vanilla extract in a large bowl. Once the smoothie is blended, pour it into a glass and serve! Making Kefir Banana Bread Preheat your oven to 350 °F (177 °C) and prepare a loaf pan. Line the loaf pan with parchment paper so that the bottom and sides of the pan are covered. Then, grease the parchment paper by spraying it with a non-stick cooking spray. Set the loaf pan aside. Mix 1 stick of melted butter and 1 cup (240 mL) of sugar in a bowl. Melt the butter in the microwave using a microwave-safe bowl, or melt it in a pot over the stovetop. Stir the melted butter and sugar until they’re thoroughly combined. Add your liquid ingredients to the butter and sugar. Add .25 cups (59 mL) of kefir, 1 teaspoon (4.9 mL) of vanilla, and 2 eggs to the butter and sugar and use a whisk to mix all the ingredients together. Continue whisking until the batter is smooth. For an even tastier kefir banana bread, sprinkle some chocolate chips or nuts into the batter. Peel 3 ripe bananas and mash them into the batter. Use the whisk or a fork to mash the bananas. If you want a chunky kefir banana bread, leave some banana chunks in the batter. If you want a smooth kefir banana bread, mash the bananas completely and whisk the batter until it’s smooth. Add your dry ingredients to the batter. Pour 2 cups (470 mL) of flour, 1 teaspoon (4.9 mL) of baking soda, and .5 teaspoons (2.5 mL) of salt into the bowl with the batter. Then, use a spatula to stir the ingredients together until you can’t see anymore of the dry flour. Transfer the batter into the loaf pan. After you pour the batter into the pan, use the spatula to scoop out any remaining batter in the bowl. Even out the top of the batter in the pan using the spatula. Bake the kefir banana bread for 1 hour. Check on the bread after 50 minutes to make sure it’s not burning. When the top of the kefir banana bread is dark brown and hardened, it’s finished baking. Remove the bread from the oven and let it cool for 20 minutes before serving. After 20 minutes, remove the the loaf of bread from the pan and cut it into slices. You can store your leftover bread at room temperature for up to 3 days, or in the freezer for 3 months.
